holidays.name: Victory in Europe Day (VE Day)
facts: VE Day marks the formal acceptance of Nazi Germany's unconditional surrender by the Allied forces in 1945.
Celebrations took place across Europe and North America, with large crowds gathering in cities like London and New York.
VE Day is a public holiday in several European countries, including France and the United Kingdom.

holidays.name: World Red Cross and Red Crescent Day
facts: This day celebrates the principles of the International Red Cross and Red Crescent Movement, which was founded by Henry Dunant.
The Red Cross and Red Crescent provide humanitarian aid in times of war and natural disasters.
The date, May 8th, was chosen to honor the birthday of Henry Dunant, the founder of the Red Cross.

holidays.name: National Teacher Appreciation Day (USA)
facts: National Teacher Appreciation Day is part of Teacher Appreciation Week, which is celebrated in the first full week of May.
The day recognizes the hard work and dedication of teachers in shaping the future of students.
Many schools and communities organize events and activities to show gratitude to teachers on this day.
